meta.title: MAKO — Make AI Agents Understand Your Business
meta.description: Open protocol that transforms web pages into optimized Markdown for AI agents. 93% fewer tokens. Works alongside llms.txt, Schema.org, and WebMCP.

hero.subtitle: Your website speaks HTML — AI agents don't. MAKO is an open protocol that gives every page a structured, token-efficient version that LLMs actually understand.

problem.title: The web was designed for humans
problem.subtitle: When an AI agent visits your site, it downloads navigation bars, cookie banners, ad scripts, and thousands of lines of markup — just to find a product name and price.
problem.stat_label: average page weight an AI agent must parse
problem.stat_detail: 4,125 tokens consumed before understanding a single product

how_it_works.title: How It Works
how_it_works.subtitle: A 6-layer architecture that turns any website into an AI-optimized endpoint — built entirely on standard HTTP.
how_it_works.layer_discovery_desc: The agent finds which URLs support MAKO via .well-known/mako, link tags, or llms.txt.
how_it_works.layer_prefilter_desc: A HEAD request returns metadata headers — token count, type, entity — without downloading the body.
how_it_works.layer_content_desc: The full MAKO document: structured frontmatter + clean markdown body in ~94% fewer tokens.
how_it_works.layer_navigation_desc: Semantic links with context let agents navigate your site with purpose, not blind crawling.
how_it_works.layer_action_desc: Machine-readable CTAs (buy, subscribe, book) with endpoints and parameters — no JavaScript needed.
how_it_works.layer_cache_desc: ETags and conditional requests let agents check for changes without re-downloading content.

how_it_works_page.meta_title: How It Works — MAKO Protocol Layers
how_it_works_page.meta_description: Deep dive into the 6 layers of the MAKO protocol: Discovery, Pre-filter, Content, Navigation, Actions, and Cache.
how_it_works_page.title: How It Works
how_it_works_page.subtitle: 6 layers that transform how AI agents interact with your website — all built on standard HTTP.

layer_discovery.title: Discovery
layer_discovery.question: How does the agent know your site supports MAKO?
layer_discovery.description: MAKO offers three discovery mechanisms: the .well-known/mako endpoint declares site-level capabilities, the <link rel="alternate"> tag signals page-level support, and the <script type="text/mako+markdown"> element embeds MAKO content directly in HTML. Together, they replace blind crawling with intentional discovery.

layer_prefilter.title: Pre-filter
layer_prefilter.question: How does the agent decide if your page is relevant — before downloading it?
layer_prefilter.description: A lightweight HEAD request returns response headers classified by RFC 2119: required headers (MUST) like version, type, tokens, and language; recommended headers (SHOULD) like ETag and Cache-Control for caching; and optional headers (MAY) like declared actions. The agent knows everything it needs to decide relevance — without transferring a single byte of content.

layer_content.title: Content
layer_content.question: What does the agent actually receive?
layer_content.description: A GET request with the MAKO Accept header returns a structured document: YAML frontmatter with typed metadata, followed by a clean markdown body. 245 tokens instead of 4,125 — a 94% reduction. Alternatively, agents can extract MAKO content directly from a script element in the HTML — no content negotiation needed.

layer_navigation.title: Navigation
layer_navigation.question: How does the agent explore related content?
layer_navigation.description: Instead of parsing 127 links from HTML (most irrelevant), the MAKO frontmatter declares semantic links with context descriptions. The agent knows that /products/running-socks are 'Matching performance socks' — not just another URL to blindly crawl.

layer_action.title: Actions
layer_action.question: How does the agent interact with your site?
layer_action.description: MAKO declares machine-readable actions in the frontmatter: add_to_cart, check_availability, notify_restock — each with a URL, method, and parameters. The agent can execute these actions directly, without parsing HTML forms or executing JavaScript.

layer_cache.title: Cache
layer_cache.question: How does the agent avoid re-downloading unchanged content?
layer_cache.description: MAKO responses include ETag and Cache-Control headers. On subsequent visits, the agent sends a conditional GET with If-None-Match. If the content hasn't changed, the server returns 304 Not Modified — zero bytes transferred, zero tokens processed.

how_it_works_page.annex_subtitle: MAKO headers follow RFC 2119 keywords to define conformance requirements.

benchmark.title: Token Efficiency
benchmark.subtitle: Real-world comparison of the same product page across different formats.
benchmark.token_note: Token counts are model-agnostic estimates (~4 chars/token), a standard approximation across BPE tokenizers.

preview.title: What a MAKO File Looks Like
preview.subtitle: Structured YAML frontmatter + optimized Markdown body. Everything an AI agent needs, nothing it doesn't.

features.title: Built for the Agent Web
features.subtitle: Every feature designed to make AI agents read the web faster and smarter.

cef.title: Compact Embedding Format
cef.description: 512-dimension embeddings compressed to ~470 bytes via int8 quantization + gzip + base64url. Transmitted in a single HTTP header.

actions.title: Declared Actions
actions.description: Machine-readable actions (add_to_cart, subscribe, book) with endpoints and parameters. Agents know what they can do before reading the content.

links.title: Semantic Links
links.description: Internal, external, and API links with context descriptions. Agents navigate your site with purpose, not by crawling blindly.

types.title: Content Types
types.description: 10 built-in types (product, article, docs, recipe, FAQ...) plus custom. Each type tells the agent exactly what structure to expect.

audience.title: Who Benefits
audience.subtitle: MAKO bridges the gap between your content and the AI agents trying to understand it.

business.title: Site Owners & Marketers
business.description: Your products and content become visible to ChatGPT, Perplexity, and every AI shopping assistant. No code changes — install a plugin and let AI agents find, understand, and recommend your business.

developer.title: Developers & Platform Teams
developer.description: A typed SDK, CLI validation, and Express middleware to add MAKO to any stack. Content negotiation, CEF embeddings, and semantic actions — all spec-compliant out of the box.

ai_builder.title: AI Agent & MCP Developers
ai_builder.description: Stop wasting tokens parsing HTML. MAKO gives your agent structured frontmatter, declared actions, and semantic links — with a HEAD request that reveals relevance before you download.

comparison.title: Works With Your Existing Stack
comparison.subtitle: MAKO doesn't replace other standards — it complements them. Each solves a different part of the AI-readiness puzzle.

llms_txt.name: llms.txt
llms_txt.focus: Site-level instructions for LLMs — what to crawl, what to skip
llms_txt.complement: Page-level structured content with frontmatter, actions, and token-efficient body

schema_org.name: Schema.org
schema_org.focus: Structured metadata for search engines (JSON-LD, microdata)
schema_org.complement: Full readable content optimized for LLM consumption, not just metadata snippets

webmcp.name: WebMCP
webmcp.focus: Exposing server tools and capabilities to AI agents via MCP
webmcp.complement: The content itself — products, articles, docs — in a format agents can read directly

cloudflare_md.name: Cloudflare /md
cloudflare_md.focus: HTML-to-Markdown conversion at the edge for any page
cloudflare_md.complement: Curated, frontmatter-rich documents with 60% fewer tokens than generic markdown

score_inline.title: How AI-ready is your site?
score_inline.subtitle: Enter your URL and get an instant MAKO Score from 0 to 100.

ecosystem.title: The Ecosystem
ecosystem.subtitle: Everything you need to start serving MAKO content today.
ecosystem.wp_desc: WordPress plugin that generates and serves MAKO content via content negotiation. WooCommerce, AI BYOK, and bulk generation.
ecosystem.js_desc: TypeScript library for parsing, generating, and validating MAKO files. Includes CEF encode/decode and Express middleware.
ecosystem.cli_desc: Command-line tool for validating, inspecting, and benchmarking MAKO files.
ecosystem.spec_desc: The full protocol specification. Content types, frontmatter schema, HTTP headers, conformance levels, and the CEF standard.

cta.title: Start serving AI-optimized content
cta.description: Choose your path. Open protocol, Apache-2.0 licensed, production-ready.
cta.wp_description: Install the plugin, activate, done. Works with WooCommerce, Yoast, and ACF.
cta.dev_description: Add MAKO to any stack with the TypeScript SDK and CLI tools.
cta.ai_description: Build agents that consume MAKO content. SDK, spec, and examples.

analyzer.title: MAKO Analyzer
analyzer.description: Paste any URL to see how MAKO optimizes it for AI agents. Get instant token savings analysis.
analyzer.meta_description: See how MAKO reduces tokens for any web page. Paste a URL and get instant analysis.

form.public_description: Allow this analysis to appear in the public directory

results.token_note: Estimates based on ~4 chars/token, a standard model-agnostic approximation for BPE tokenizers. The savings ratio remains representative across models.

errors.fetch_failed: Could not fetch this URL. Please check the URL and try again.

directory.title: Public Analyses
directory.description: Browse publicly shared MAKO analyses from the community.
directory.meta_description: Browse publicly shared MAKO analyses and see real-world token savings.

list.no_results: No public analyses yet. Be the first to share one!

score.title: MAKO Score
score.description: How AI-ready is your website? Get your score from 0 to 100 across Discoverable, Readable, Trustworthy, and Actionable.
score.about: MAKO Score measures how efficiently AI agents can discover, read, trust, and interact with your content.
score.meta_description: Check how AI-ready your website is. Get a score from 0-100 across discoverability, readability, trustworthiness, and actionability for AI agents.

form.public_description: Allow this score to appear publicly and be shared

business.top_actions: Top Actions to Improve Your Score
business.mako_cta_desc: Implement the MAKO protocol to give AI agents direct access to your optimized content. Install <js>@mako-spec/js</js> or the <wp>WordPress plugin</wp> to get started.

recommendations.perfect: Perfect score! Your site is fully optimized for AI agents.
recommendations.subtitle: Improvements ordered by impact. Fix these to raise your score.

share.og_description: {domain} scored {score}/100 on AI-readiness. Check your website's MAKO Score.

discoverable.name: Discoverable
discoverable.question: Can AI agents discover you?
discoverable.info_what: Checks whether AI agents can find your optimized content: MAKO support, llms.txt, content negotiation, and discovery signals.
discoverable.info_why: If agents can't discover your content, nothing else matters. This category ensures your site is visible to the AI web.

readable.name: Readable
readable.question: Can AI agents understand you?
readable.info_what: Measures how cleanly AI agents can extract and understand your content: signal-to-noise ratio, semantic HTML, headings, and JavaScript dependency.
readable.info_why: Most web pages are 90%+ boilerplate. Agents need clean, structured content to generate accurate responses about your business.

trustworthy.name: Trustworthy
trustworthy.question: Can AI agents trust you?
trustworthy.info_what: Evaluates metadata quality and freshness: JSON-LD, Open Graph, canonical URLs, robots.txt, and MAKO-specific trust signals like summaries and ETags.
trustworthy.info_why: Trust signals help agents verify content accuracy, understand context, and decide whether to cite your page in responses.

actionable.name: Actionable
actionable.question: Can AI agents interact with you?
actionable.info_what: Checks whether agents can interact with your content: structured actions, semantic links, MAKO headers completeness, and content extraction quality.
actionable.info_why: The future of the agent web is transactional. If agents can't find your buy, subscribe, or contact actions, you miss conversions.

serves_mako.name: Serves MAKO content
serves_mako.info: MAKO lets agents get your content in ~7% of the tokens of raw HTML — the biggest single improvement.

mako_content_negotiation.name: MAKO content negotiation
mako_content_negotiation.info: The correct Content-Type header ensures agents parse your response as MAKO, not generic text.

mako_link_tag.name: MAKO discovery link tag
mako_link_tag.info: A <link rel="alternate"> tag lets agents discover MAKO support without making an extra HEAD request.

has_llms_txt.name: Has llms.txt
has_llms_txt.info: llms.txt tells AI agents what your site offers and how to access it — like robots.txt for LLMs.

has_mcp_endpoint.name: Has MCP endpoint
has_mcp_endpoint.info: Model Context Protocol (MCP) lets agents interact with your service as a structured API.

content_signal_ratio.name: Content signal ratio
content_signal_ratio.info: Measures how much of your page is actual content vs navigation, ads, and boilerplate markup.

no_js_dependency.name: Content without JavaScript
no_js_dependency.info: LLMs and crawlers cannot execute JavaScript. If content requires JS, it's invisible to AI agents.

first_meaningful_content.name: First meaningful content
first_meaningful_content.info: Agents scan the first few hundred characters. If they find only nav/header, they may skip your page.

meaningful_headings.name: Meaningful headings
meaningful_headings.info: Descriptive headings let agents do smart skimming — understanding structure without reading everything.

semantic_html.name: Semantic HTML structure
semantic_html.info: Tags like <main>, <article>, <section> tell agents where the real content lives.

has_h1.name: Has single H1
has_h1.info: The H1 is the primary signal agents use to understand what a page is about.

image_alt_text.name: Images have alt text
image_alt_text.info: Without alt text, images are invisible to agents. With it, they understand your visual content.

link_quality.name: Descriptive link text
link_quality.info: Links with descriptive text let agents navigate purposefully, not blindly crawl click here links.

has_json_ld.name: JSON-LD structured data
has_json_ld.info: Schema.org in JSON-LD lets agents understand content type (product, article, event) without guessing.

has_og_tags.name: Open Graph tags
has_og_tags.info: Open Graph tags are used by social platforms AND AI agents to preview and classify content.

has_meta_description.name: Meta description
has_meta_description.info: The meta description is the quick summary agents use when they don't read the full page.

has_canonical.name: Canonical URL
has_canonical.info: Canonical URLs prevent agents from indexing duplicate versions of your content.

has_lang.name: Language attribute
has_lang.info: The lang attribute tells agents what language your content is in, improving comprehension.

has_robots_txt.name: robots.txt
has_robots_txt.info: A permissive robots.txt signals that crawlers and AI agents are welcome on your site.

has_sitemap.name: Sitemap
has_sitemap.info: Sitemaps help agents discover all your pages without crawling link by link.

mako_summary_quality.name: MAKO summary quality
mako_summary_quality.info: A well-crafted summary (10-30 words, ≤160 chars) is what agents use to describe your business.

mako_freshness.name: MAKO content freshness
mako_freshness.info: The X-Mako-Updated header tells agents how recent your content is — stale data loses trust.

mako_etag.name: MAKO ETag caching
mako_etag.info: ETags enable efficient caching — agents check if content changed without re-downloading everything.

mako_tokens_declared.name: MAKO token count declared
mako_tokens_declared.info: Declared token count lets agents plan their context window budget before downloading.

mako_body_quality.name: MAKO body quality
mako_body_quality.info: Enough body content (≥200 chars) ensures agents have substance to work with.

structured_actions.name: Structured actions
structured_actions.info: Machine-readable actions (buy, subscribe, contact) let agents guide users to conversions.

semantic_links.name: Semantic links
semantic_links.info: MAKO links with context let agents navigate your site with purpose and understanding.

action_completeness.name: Action completeness
action_completeness.info: Complete actions (name + description + url) give agents everything they need to act.

mako_headers_complete.name: MAKO headers complete
mako_headers_complete.info: All 7 MAKO headers provide agents with a complete metadata picture at the HTTP level.

clean_extraction.name: Clean content extraction
clean_extraction.info: At least 200 characters of extractable content ensures agents have enough to generate useful responses.

F.title: Invisible to AI agents
F.description: Your site can't be parsed by AI agents reliably. Basic structure is missing.

D.title: Readable with effort
D.description: Agents can extract some data, but results may be inaccurate. Key signals are missing.

C.title: Accessible but inefficient
C.description: Good base structure. Agents understand you but consume excess tokens doing so.

B.title: Optimized for AI
B.description: Agents read you well and efficiently. MAKO implementation unlocks the next level.

A.title: Agent-ready
A.description: Fast discovery, reliable structured data, and efficient token usage.

A_plus.title: Agent-first
A_plus.description: Your site speaks the language of AI agents natively. Perfect score.

serves_mako.message: Implement MAKO content negotiation with @mako-spec/js middleware or mako-wp plugin.
serves_mako.businessMessage: Enable AI agents to read your content directly — this is the single biggest improvement you can make.

mako_content_negotiation.message: Ensure your server returns Content-Type: text/mako+markdown for MAKO responses.
mako_content_negotiation.businessMessage: Fix your MAKO setup so AI agents correctly identify your optimized content.

mako_link_tag.message: Add <link rel="alternate" type="text/mako+markdown"> to your HTML <head>.
mako_link_tag.businessMessage: Help AI agents discover that your site supports optimized content.

has_llms_txt.message: Add an llms.txt file at your site root describing your site for AI agents.
has_llms_txt.businessMessage: Tell AI assistants what your business does so they can recommend you accurately.

has_mcp_endpoint.message: Add a /.well-known/mcp.json endpoint for Model Context Protocol integration.
has_mcp_endpoint.businessMessage: Enable advanced AI integrations with your site.

content_signal_ratio.message: Reduce HTML bloat by removing unnecessary scripts, inline styles, and non-semantic markup.
content_signal_ratio.businessMessage: Clean up your page code so AI agents can focus on your actual content, not boilerplate.

no_js_dependency.message: Serve content as static/SSR HTML. LLM agents and crawlers cannot execute JavaScript.
no_js_dependency.businessMessage: Make your content available without JavaScript — most AI agents can't run scripts.

first_meaningful_content.message: Ensure the H1 and main content appear within the first 300 characters of the document.
first_meaningful_content.businessMessage: Move your main content higher on the page so AI agents find it immediately.

meaningful_headings.message: Use descriptive headings that summarize section content. Avoid generic headings like Welcome.
meaningful_headings.businessMessage: Use clear section titles so AI agents understand your page structure.

semantic_html.message: Use semantic HTML elements: <main>, <article>, <section> to structure content.
semantic_html.businessMessage: Use proper HTML structure so AI agents can identify your main content area.

has_h1.message: Add exactly one H1 heading that describes the page's main topic.
has_h1.businessMessage: Add a clear main heading — it's the first thing AI agents look for.

image_alt_text.message: Add descriptive alt text to images so AI agents understand visual content.
image_alt_text.businessMessage: Describe your images in text so AI agents know what they show.

link_quality.message: Replace generic link text (click here, read more) with descriptive labels.
link_quality.businessMessage: Use meaningful link labels so AI agents understand where each link goes.

has_json_ld.message: Add JSON-LD structured data (Schema.org) with at least 5 properties.
has_json_ld.businessMessage: Add structured data so AI agents understand exactly what your page is about.

has_og_tags.message: Add Open Graph tags: og:title, og:description, og:type, og:image.
has_og_tags.businessMessage: Add social sharing tags — AI agents use them to summarize your content.

has_meta_description.message: Add a <meta name="description"> with a concise page summary.
has_meta_description.businessMessage: Add a page description that AI agents can use as a content summary.

has_canonical.message: Add <link rel="canonical"> to identify the primary URL for this content.
has_canonical.businessMessage: Tell AI agents which URL is the official one for this page.

has_lang.message: Add a lang attribute to <html> (e.g., <html lang="en">).
has_lang.businessMessage: Declare your page language so AI agents respond in the right language.

has_robots_txt.message: Add a robots.txt that allows AI crawlers to access your content.
has_robots_txt.businessMessage: Allow AI agents to crawl your site by adding a robots.txt file.

has_sitemap.message: Add a sitemap.xml to help crawlers discover all your pages.
has_sitemap.businessMessage: Help AI agents find all your important pages with a sitemap.

mako_summary_quality.message: Add a summary field (10-30 words, ≤160 chars) to your MAKO frontmatter.
mako_summary_quality.businessMessage: Write a clear summary in your MAKO file — AI agents use it to describe your business.

mako_freshness.message: Set X-Mako-Updated header to the content's last modification date.
mako_freshness.businessMessage: Keep your AI-optimized content up to date — stale data hurts trust.

mako_etag.message: Add an ETag header to MAKO responses for efficient caching.
mako_etag.businessMessage: Enable caching so AI agents can efficiently check for content updates.

mako_tokens_declared.message: Set X-Mako-Tokens header to declare the token count of your MAKO content.
mako_tokens_declared.businessMessage: Declare content size so AI agents can plan their token budget.

mako_body_quality.message: Ensure MAKO body content has at least 200 characters of meaningful markdown.
mako_body_quality.businessMessage: Provide enough content in your MAKO file for AI agents to work with.

structured_actions.message: Add machine-readable CTAs/actions. In MAKO, define actions with name, description, and url.
structured_actions.businessMessage: Define clear actions (buy, subscribe, contact) so AI agents can guide users to them.

semantic_links.message: Include semantic links with context in your MAKO frontmatter.
semantic_links.businessMessage: Connect your pages with meaningful links so AI agents can navigate your site.

action_completeness.message: Ensure all MAKO actions have name, description, and url fields.
action_completeness.businessMessage: Complete your action definitions so AI agents have all the info they need.

mako_headers_complete.message: Include all MAKO headers: Version, Type, Lang, Entity, Tokens, Updated, Canonical.
mako_headers_complete.businessMessage: Provide complete metadata so AI agents get the full picture of your content.

clean_extraction.message: Ensure your page has at least 200 characters of extractable content.
clean_extraction.businessMessage: Add more content to your page — AI agents need substance to work with.

check_details.content_signal_ratio_low: Content signal ratio is {ratio}% — too much boilerplate
check_details.no_js_dependency_fail: Page required JavaScript rendering (Jina fallback used)
check_details.first_meaningful_content_fail: Main content doesn't appear early enough — too much navigation or boilerplate before real content
check_details.meaningful_headings_generic: {generic}/{total} headings are generic or too short
check_details.link_quality_fail: {bad}/{total} links have generic text like click here

site_scan.description: Checks up to 10 pages on your site to see which ones serve MAKO content. This shows your site-wide MAKO adoption.
site_scan.no_mako: No MAKO pages detected yet. Adopt the MAKO protocol to let AI agents read your site efficiently.
site_scan.partial: {count} of {total} URLs serve MAKO. Extend adoption across your site to maximize AI accessibility.
